contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Television episode | Title = A Hundred Yards Over the Rim | Series = The Twilight Zone | Image =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:A Hundred Years Over the Rim.jpg|250px]] --> | Caption = [[Cliff Robertson]] in "A Hundred Yards Over the Rim" | Season = 2 | Episode = 59 | Airdate =April 7, 1961 | Production = 173-3654 | Writer =[[Rod Serling]] | Director =[[Buzz Kulik]] | Guests =[[Cliff Robertson]]: Chris Horn <br /> [[John Crawford (actor)|John Crawford]]: Joe <br /> Miranda Jones: Martha Horn <br /> [[Evans Evans]]: Mary Lou <br /> [[John Astin]]: Charlie <br /> [[Edward Platt]]: Doctor | Music = [[Fred Steiner]] | Episode list = [[List of Twilight Zone episodes]] | Prev = [[Long Distance Call]] | Next = [[The Rip Van Winkle Caper]] }} "'''A Hundred Yards Over the Rim'''" is an episode of the [[American television]] anthology series ''[[The Twilight Zone (1959 TV series)|The Twilight Zone]]''. ==Plot== In the year 1847, Chris Horn ([[Cliff Robertson]]) is one of the leaders of a small [[wagon train]] from Ohio attempting to reach California. Horn's wife and young son Christian are in one [[Conestoga wagon]] of the group. When his son becomes dangerously ill, he sets off alone in a desperate search for water. Horn crosses over a high sandy hill rim and suddenly finds himself in 1961 New Mexico. He is stunned to see power lines, a seemingly endless hard black road, and a loud, fast-moving "monster with a face" coming at him. As the truck zooms past the unnerved Horn, he stumbles, accidentally firing his rifle and slightly wounding his arm. He comes to a small café with gas pumps in front. The friendly couple inside offer him water and help him with his injury. They ask where he is from, curious about his old-fashioned clothes and his "antique" rifle. When Horn is shocked to see the year 1961 showing on the wall calendar, the couple assume that the desert heat has made him mentally unstable. Exploring the café, Horn finds an encyclopedia containing a brief biographical entry for "Christian Horn, Jr.", a physician who achieved good works in late 19th-Century California. Horn realizes that this must be his son who is sick, and that it must be his son's destiny to recover from the illness and go on to help many others. However, during his time in the café, Horn arouses too much curiosity. A local doctor alerts the sheriff, but before the authorities can arrive, Horn runs back to the rim, narrowly escaping back to the wagon party and his son, holding in his hand a bottle of penicillin from 1961 that can cure his son's illness. He notices that he is no longer being chased and looks back over the rim to find unsettled territory, the power lines and highway vanished. After giving his son the medicine, he leads the party on toward California. The café owner had chased Horn to the top of the rim but had found only Horn's rifle lying on the ground. He returns to the café to report that Horn unexplainably vanished but that he brought back the rifle that Horn dropped. The rifle, now aged more than 100 years in the sun, falls apart at his touch. ==See also== *[[List of The Twilight Zone episodes]] ==References== *DeVoe, Bill. (2008).
